p: All experiments were performed at least in triplicate. For MIC and NIC determination, each experiment was performed at least 4 times, and standard deviation was calculated by Fig.P software (Fig.P Software Incorporated, Hamilton, ON, Canada). Significance was established at p < 0.05 and the results were analyzed for statistical significance with analysis of variance (ANOVA). Duncan’s multiple range test was used to determine significant differences among results using Statistica v.10.0. The IC 50 (inhibition concentration) and EC 50 (efficient concentration) values were calculated as previously described [ 12]. For comet assay, statistical differences between groups were evaluated by ANOVA followed by Dunnett’s or Tukey’s test. A level of p < 0.05 was considered statistically significant. All statistical analyses were performed using GraphPad Prism 5 (GraphPad Software, San Diego, CA, USA).
